FuncDef:
The speed 40000 command configures an Ethernet interface to work at a specified rate.
The undo speed command restores the default rate of an Ethernet interface. The speed 40000 command configures an Ethernet interface to work at a specified rate. The undo speed command restores the default rate of an Ethernet interface. By default, an Ethernet interface works at its highest rate.
ParentView: Layer 2 100GE interface view,100GE interface view,Layer 2 200GE interface view,200GE interface view,400GE-L2 view,400GE interface view,Interface group view
ExtraInfo: If the interfaces on two devices connected using a 100G high-speed cable work at different rates and cannot go Up, run the speed 40000 command to set the same rate for the two interfaces. This prevents communication failures.
